alert.note: Alert for Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 7:36PM CST until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Niobrara River near Sparks affecting Cherry County. For the Niobrara River...including Sparks...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Niobrara River near Sparks. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding along the left bank downstream from Berry Bridge to Smith Falls Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Tuesday /6:15 PM MST Tuesday/ the stage was 6.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CST Tuesday /6:15 PM MST Tuesday/ was 6.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.6 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.6 feet on 03/15/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Niobrara River Sparks 6.0 6.6 Tue 7 pm CST 6.0 6.0 6.0 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at noon CST /1100 AM MST/.
